intro: Ophrestia upembae, commonly known as the Upemba mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees, such as those in the genus *Ficus*. The plant has small, scale-like leaves and produces tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. Its seeds are dispersed by birds, which consume the fleshy, red berries. Ophrestia upembae plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by influencing host tree growth and providing food for wildlife.
